description: From French façade, from Italian facciata, a derivation of faccia (“front”), from Latin faciēs (“face”); compare face.

entries.meaning: (architecture) The face of a building, especially the front view or elevation.
(by extension) The face or front (most visible side) of any other thing, such as an organ.
(figuratively) A deceptive or insincere outward appearance.
examples: Synonyms: appearance, cover, front, guise, pretence; see also Thesaurus:fake

entries.meaning: (programming) An object serving as a simplified interface to a larger body of code, as in the facade pattern.
